definition: to fire a gun/to substitute for sb in sitting an examination
to beat/to strike/to hit/to break/to type/to mix up/to build/to fight/to fetch/to make/to tie up/to issue/to shoot/to calculate/to play (a game)/since/from
gun/firearm/rifle/spear/thing with shape or function similar to a gun/CL:支[zhi1],把[ba3],桿|杆[gan3],條|条[tiao2],枝[zhi1]/to substitute for another person in a test/to knock/classifier for rifle shots

sentences.english: Why don't you learn to use one.
sentences.chinese: 为什么不学学怎么打枪。

sentences.english: Don't you think setting fireworks is better than shooting guns into the air?
sentences.chinese: 你不认为放焰火比往天上打枪更好吗？

sentences.english: He was a barrister of Philadelphia, but became far more renowned by his gun than by his law cases.
sentences.chinese: 他是费城的律师，但他打官司远不及打枪出名。

sentences.english: Still, the men with the big guns are gone, or at least have been driven underground.
sentences.chinese: 带着打枪的人也消失了，或者至少已经被赶到了地下。

sentences.english: Pretty soon, at scattered places along the front, the rifles ceased firing.
sentences.chinese: 很快，前线某些阵地的国民党士兵就不再打枪了。

sentences.english: You play good, since one can fire a gun with you a granddaughter.
sentences.chinese: 你玩得不错，以后可以跟你孙女一块打枪了。

sentences.english: "Morrel, " said the count, "have you ever seen me fire a pistol?
sentences.chinese: “莫雷尔，”伯爵说，“从来没有见过我打枪吧？”

sentences.english: Jealousy is one of the quickest and surest ways to get dumped.
sentences.chinese: 嫉妒是最快最可能被打枪的一种。

definition: to open fire/to shoot a gun
to open fire with artillery/to set off firecrackers/to make one's stage debut/(slang) to have sex/to masturbate
to open fire/to shoot a gun
devils/refers to 日本鬼子, wartime term insult for Japanese
to throw an explosive charge/to bomb
